Create NocoDB tables

Source: R/rdb.gen.R
create_nocodb_tbls.Rd

Creates all the PostgreSQL database tables that must be first created once in NocoDB after the PostgreSQL database has been added as external data source (e.g. via reset_nocodb()) to let NocoDB register the necessary metadata for the created_by and updated_by columns (so they are properly auto-filled by NocoDB later on).

After running create_nocodb_tbls(), the created tables are supposed to be recreated outside of NocoDB via pg_init_main_tbls().

Usage

create_nocodb_tbls(hostname = nocodb_hostname)

Arguments

hostname

NocoDB server hostname. A character scalar.

Value

A tibble with metadata about the newly created tables.

See also

Other NocoDB functions config_nocodb_tbls(), purge_nocodb(), reset_nocodb(), reset_rdb()

Other administration functions: config_nocodb_tbls(), connect(), delete_rfrnds(), dm(), notify_postgrest(), purge_nocodb(), reset_nocodb(), reset_rdb(), restart_postgrest(), update_countries(), update_langs(), update_municipalities(), update_rfrnds(), update_subnational_entities(), update_tbl()
